SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

quiver
Class Quiver

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--quiver.Quiver
public class Quiver
extends Object

represents quiver, and provides operations on and access to items contained in the quiver, including points (vertices), arrows, and relations

Inner Class Summary
protected  class Quiver.ArrowEndpointsMap
          This final inner class keeps track of arrows based on their endpoints, regardless of orientation.
protected  class Quiver.ArrowToRelationsMap
          This is another inner class which is used to organize relations based on the starting arrows of the relations.
protected  class Quiver.PointToArrowsMap
          Inner class for mapping points to vector of arrows starting/ending at point.
protected  class Quiver.QItemMap
          inner class which maps items to vectors of other items
 
Field Summary
protected  Quiver.ArrowEndpointsMap arrendptmap
          maps pairs of endpoints to arrows between them
protected  Quiver.ArrowToRelationsMap arrowrelmap
          maps arrows to relations
protected  Vector items
          the items (points, arrows, relations) in the quiver
protected  Quiver.PointToArrowsMap ptarrowmap
          maps points in the quiver to their associated arrows
protected  QUndoRedoStack undoRedoStack
          undo/redo stack

          constructor

Parameters:
path - the path determining the zero relation
Returns:

getSelectedZeroRelations

public Vector getSelectedZeroRelations()
Get the selected zero relations, and return them in a vector. This is used for constructing commutativity relations.
Returns:
vector of selected zero relations

getSelectedPaths

public Vector getSelectedPaths()
Get the paths in selected zero relations, and return them in a vector
Returns:
vector of paths in selected zero relations

haveSameStartEndPts

public boolean haveSameStartEndPts(Vector paths)
checks that paths in vector have same start/end pts
Returns:
true iff start/end points match

addCommutativityRelation

public QCommutativityRelation addCommutativityRelation()
Adds commutativity relation consisting of selected zero relations. The selected zero relations are then removed. The selected zero relations must have the same start/end points
Returns:
the new commutativity relation (if it was successfully constructed), or null

addCommutativityRelation

public QCommutativityRelation addCommutativityRelation(Vector paths)
Adds a commutativity relation to the quiver. This is used when non-interactively reconstructing a quiver from a string parameter.
Parameters:
the - paths determining the relation
Returns:
the commutativity relation

getIncidentPoints

public Vector getIncidentPoints(QPoint pt)
get the points incident (i.e., at opposite end of some arrow) to another point
Parameters:
pt - the point
Returns:
a vector of points incident to given point

draw

public void draw(Graphics2D g)
draws the items in the quiver by calling the draw method for each item
Parameters:
g - a graphics context onto which the quiver is drawn

pathToString

protected String pathToString(QPath p,
                              QItemToIntegerMap iindex)
Encode path as a string. This is used for representing relations as strings which can then be used to non-interactively reconstruct a quiver from a string parameter
Parameters:
p - the path
iindex - map which associates each item in the quiver to its index in the items vector

encode

public String encode()
Encode quiver as string. This is used for representing the quiver as a string which can then be used to non-interactively reconstruct the quiver from a string parameter

arrayFromList

protected int[] arrayFromList(String str)
Convert comma separated list of integers to array. This is used to decode a string representation of a path in a relation when non-interactively reconstructing a quiver from a string parameter.
Parameters:
str - comma separated list of integers
Returns:
array of integers in the string

pathFromArray

protected QPath pathFromArray(int[] a)
Get path from array of indices pointing to arrows in items vector. This is used to decode a string representation of a path in a relation when non-interactively reconstructing a quiver from a string parameter.
Parameters:
a - array of integers representing indices of arrows in items vector
Returns:
path consisting of the arrows in the array

decodePaths

protected Vector decodePaths(String str)
get vector of paths from string consisting of lists of indices of arrows, separated by semicolons This is used to decode a string representation of paths in a commutativity relation when non-interactively reconstructing a quiver from a string parameter.
Parameters:
str - string representation of the list of paths
Returns:
vector of paths represented by string

decode

public void decode(String str)
Decode string representation of quiver. This is used to non-interactively reconstruct a quiver from a string parameter.
Parameters:
str - string representation of quiver, as produced by the encode() method

extent

public Rectangle extent()
get smallest rectangle containing the quiver. It suffices to find smallest rectangle containing the points.
Returns:
rectangle containing the quiver

translate

public void translate(int dx,
                      int dy)
translate the quiver by dx, dy. For this, it suffices to translate the points. Everything else will follow
Parameters:
dx - x distance for translation
dy - y distance for translation

undo

public void undo()
performs undo operation if possible

redo

public void redo()
performs undo operation if possible
